alert.note: Alert for Winnebago (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 2:02PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Winnebago County through 230 PM CDT... At 202 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lake Poygan, or 14 miles northeast of Berlin, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Poygan, Winneconne, Zittau, Clarks Point, Orihula, Rivermoor, Metz and Boom Bay. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
